article:
Honda Motor Company, Ltd. operates plants worldwide for the manufacture of their
products. In a vehicle identification number (VIN), the 11th digit indicates the
factory the auto has been built in.

Note:  The Marysville plant started assembling motorcycles in 1979, cars in
       1982. In February 2007, Honda announced that it would cease production of
       motorcycles in the United States in spring 2009. [http://www.usatoday.com/money/autos/2008-02-27-honda-
       motorcycles_N.htm?csp=34 Honda to end motorcycle production in
       U.S.]
